title: Substance Use Outcomes of an Integrated HIV–Substance Use Treatment Model Implemented by Social Workers and HIV Medical Providers
abstract: Journal Article Substance Use Outcomes of an Integrated HIV–Substance Use Treatment Model Implemented by Social Workers and HIV Medical Providers Get access Rae Jean Proeschold-Bell, Rae Jean Proeschold-Bell Rae Jean Proeschold-Bell, PhD, is associate research professor and Susan Reif, PhD, MSW, is a research associate, Center for Health Policy & Inequalities Research, Duke University, Durham, NC. Baishakhi Taylor, PhD, is dean of students, Middlebury College, Middlebury, VT. Ashwin Patkar, MD, is professor and Paolo Mannelli, MD, is associate professor, Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences, Duke University School of Medicine, Durham, NC. Jia Yao, MA, is a data analyst, Center for Health Policy & Inequalities Research, Duke University, Durham, NC. Evelyn Byrd Quinlivan, MD, is clinical associate professor, University of North Carolina School of Medicine, Chapel Hill. Address correspondence to Rae Jean Proeschold-Bell, Center for Health Policy & Inequalities Research, Duke University, Box 90392, Durham, NC 27708–0392; This study was funded by grant TI18825 from the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration, with additional support from the UNC Centers for AIDS Research (P30-AI50410) and help from the Duke University Center for AIDS Research, a National Institutes of Health funded program (5P30 AI064518). The authors wish to thank their dedicated team members, including Douglas Thomas, project director; interviewers, Barbara Fisher and Christopher Foye; their licensed clinical social workers, Keith McAdam, Amy Carmen, Katie Cooper, Laura Musselwhite, Natasha Bowditch, and Katie Jorgensen; and their medical providers, Sandy Gomez, Amy Heine, and Heidi Swygard. e-mail: rae.jean@duke.edu.
